Message.Title: THIS SEEKING ALPHA ARTICLE SEZ....MSFT RT...." DOESN'T WORK" STICK TO SOFTWARE...INSTEAD OF MALWARE BING.
Message.Msg: Conclusion I suppose that Microsoft's Surface needed to really kick-start the PC and tablet designs going forward with its Surface products, but I think the rest of the industry gets the message. The winners are the ones with the best designs that sell through to fickle customers, and the losers are the ones with the mundane and tough to use products. Microsoft's job should be to make sure the Windows OS is as user friendly and as great as it can be, Intel's job should be to make sure Windows products have the best silicon, and the OEMs' jobs are to figure out what devices based on these solid building blocks that people and to build them to scale. Microsoft's Surface doesn't work, and the sooner Microsoft cuts the cord on both RT and Pro devices, the better it is for Microsoft and its partners.

Message.Title: Microsoft's U-Turn Does It No Good
Message.Msg: Google it. Quoting: "I did not attend the E3 conference but rather had it covered by four national buyers at large video game retailers -- three from the U.S. and one from Germany -- who then shared their notes and their opinions with me after the event. Since they are the ones who issue the purchase orders for both consoles and games, their opinions in fact are much more important than those of any of the gurus who went there and then offered their insights. "Firstly, they, like everybody else, were surprised by the PS4 triumph and the XBox One fiasco. They believe that three factors will virtually ensure that Sony (SNE) will totally clobber Microsoft (MSFT) when the two machines come to market in November this year: "*The price differential between the PS4 at $399 and Xbox One's $499 is huge. "*The fact that Sony has very definitely ruled out any blockage of used games in comparison to Microsoft's wavering and eventual U-turn has already damaged the latter's chances in the eyes of the core gaming consumer group. "* PS4's GPU appears to have as much as 50% more graphical computational power than the one in the Xbox One. That, coupled with its faster graphics memory, will translate into faster downloads, sharper graphics, and an overall superior gaming experience. As far as the dedicated core gamer is concerned, this is of much greater consequence than the fact that the Xbox One has multimedia capabilities designed to invade the living room as opposed to the gamer's den. "Whatever the reasons were, the impressions the four buyers took away from the E3 were clearly supported by research conducted by IGN." _________________________________________ Cue osso-bot pretending to know more than the experts...

Topic.Title: Volume, volume, volume, lesson for CFury, market moe ron

Message.Msg: " The number of trades is in no way an indication of market participation." Now you stop that, yer killin' me. As long as the motivation is to eventually sell for more than you buy for volume will matter.

Message.Title: Why volume of demand matters, in it's most simple, easy to understand form
Message.Msg: People go long in stocks hoping the price will rise to eventually sell. As the price rises people are less likely to sell as they see paper profits. Still there are billions of shares they hope to sell higher at some point. To actually sell those shares will require billions bought, if there is no volume demand prices will drop as quickly or more quickly than they rose. The last two days (higher volume) gave back the last two months of rise.

Topic.Title: Why volume of demand matters, in it's most simple, easy to understand form

Message.Msg: "The last two days (higher volume) gave back the last two months of rise." Therein lies the problem, Volume is a lagging indicator of absolutely no use to the DAYTRADER. Farthermore it's no guarantee of tomorrows price since stocks move on RT NEWS you could see a stock up today on heavy volume and you would reason "that's it", it's going up. However, BAD NEWS could come out, I was actually in a stock doing good when news hit that the sec ran off with the CEO and the money, and the stock took a nose dive. You're looking for a magic carrot that cannot lose and those don't exist. What you can do is monitor stocks in RT and learn how to "Play". Like a good professional poker player, you won't win them all but you will win your share.

Message.Title: Gallup: Obamacare = America's Employers on Hold
Message.Msg: Forty-one percent of the businesses surveyed have frozen hiring because of the health-care law known as Obamacare. And almost one-fifth - 19 percent - answered "yes" when asked if they had "reduced the number of employees you have in your business as a specific result of the Affordable Care Act." Another 38 percent of the small business owners said they "have pulled back on their plans to grow their business" because of Obamacare. -- Reported by Dan Mangan, CNBC Obama. America's employers on hold.

Message.Msg: Wow. You've actually been pickled in the dumb-bass kool-aid. That or you have the life experience of a 12 to 22 year old. {Fifty two % of the surveyed are rabid tea party republicans.} You simply pulled that one out of your dumb-bass. { If they want to not grow their business for politics, it's up to them} "Want" or politics have nothing to do with it, dumb-bass. Businesses can't afford to spend their cash reserves on things they critically NEED to do now, like repairs and upgrades for facilities, equipment, computers, vehicles, etc. {ObamaCare doesn't hurt them in any way. It helps them.} Spoken like a daydreaming 8 year old girl as she colors her pictures of purple unicorns and pink hearts for Justin Bieber. But then her age excuses her from living in fantasy land. Obamacare is going to be lumped in with Medicaid and Social Security going bankrupt within five years. It's going to create trillions in debt. America is undergoing suicide by entitlement spending. {Must not be much in the false scandals against Obama news this morning.} There's not, unless you watch or listen to the sources that the majority of America gets their news from. All the rest - ABC, NBC, CBS, CNN, MSNBC, HuffPo, WaPo, NYT - have avoided the stories of corruption as aggressively as possible so the low information Democrat base dumb-basses won't even hear of them. {Have to resort to aged false stories about ObamaCare.} Uh, the poll just came out this week, Frito. Dumb-bass.

Message.Title: Guarding Against the Big-Government Kook Left and RINO's of Washington
Message.Msg: (AP) June 21, 2012 Federal Nullification Efforts Mounting in States An Associated Press analysis found that about 80% of states now have enacted local laws that directly reject or ignore federal laws on marijuana use, gun control, health insurance requirements and identification standards for driver's licenses. Thank God there are still enough good, knowledgeable state Attorney Generals out there that will legally challenge the federal government EVERY TIME they do things they have no authority to do.

Message.Title: ORCL has 390,000 corporate clients who would use Windows Azure Cloud starting Monday June 24/2013....
Message.Msg: Folks Monday there is a major conference call with the analysts and MSFT/ORCL CEOs.... AS of June 1/2103 we had 250,000 Cloud customers, up 25% from the month before, and with this one deal we will add another 390,000 major Cloud customers with "Zero" marketing cost.... SO by the end of Q2/2013 our Cloud customer base will be over 700,000 or up "over 250% growth" since the end of Q1/2013.... AND that will make it much easier for the analysts to assign a growth company P/E of over 25% to Mr. Softy. Osso

Message.Title: Larry Kudlow Admits Today He Was Totally Wrong About Threat of Inflation
Message.Msg: Ludlow wrote in his column today: "In recent months I have commended Bernanke for producing low inflation, after many of us wrongly predicted higher inflation." OK. Well, it's sort of OBVIOUS. But the bigger question is: How long before Cavuto and Hannity and the Fox cult gurus finally admit they also were not only wrong, but swindled their audience into buying gold and missing out on the biggest stock rally in American history. Kudos to Kudlow for his manning up and admitting he was "wrong" today. Now Fox needs to get on their knees and apologize to their cult-like audience for making them lose money with their really bad financial "predictions".

Message.Title: IF you think CRM's P/E of 110 is stupid, wait till you see AMZN's....
Message.Msg: Folks Heather Bellini has a P/E of 110 for CRM on a fictitious earnings of 50 cents a share, but in fact they have never had and will never have any real earnings as the 50 cents is all Non-GAAP.... IF you think CRM's P/E is crazy, just take a look at AMZN, which also makes no money but also has some fictitious earning of $1.30 or a P/E of 200.... AND if you want to read something even more ridiculous just look at their 1-year PT of $315 or Heather Bellini's of $370 or P/E of 242 and 285 respectively.... SO Mr. Softy at P/E multiple of 25 and $4 earnings and PT of $100.00 is in fact low balling our company. Osso
